concept.title: Conditional processing attribute values
concept.shortdesc: Conditional processing attributes classify elements with metadata. The metadata is specified using space-delimited string values or grouped values.

conbody.draft-comment: Need to rework the short description to avoid confusing this with classification, per call with Kris
conbody.p:
The simplest and most common way to specify metadata on a conditional processing attribute is using individual string values. For example, the values basic and deluxe within

indicate that the paragraph applies to the basic and deluxe products.
Setting a conditional processing attribute to an empty value, such as product="", is equivalent to omitting that attribute from the element.
